meanings.definition: A person who imitates or follows the work or style of another, especially an inferior imitator.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was an epigonus of the famous painter, trying to copy every brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: The epigonus attempted to replicate the author's writing style but fell short in originality.
meanings.sent3: The epigonus thought they could mimic the chef's recipe perfectly, but ended up with a burnt mess.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, he was considered an epigonus, always echoing the melodies of his mentor.
meanings.sent5: The epigonus's art was like a faded photocopy, lacking the vibrancy of the original.

meanings.definition: A descendant or follower, especially in a literary or artistic sense.
meanings.sent1: As the epigonus of the renowned poet, she felt the weight of living up to his legacy.
meanings.sent2: The young writer was proud to be the epigonus of a famous novelist, carrying on the family tradition.
meanings.sent3: The epigonus of the legendary sculptor inherited both his talent and his quirky sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as the epigonus of her grandmother, continuing the family tradition of storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The epigonus's work was a beautiful tribute to the original artist, honoring their memory.
